meanings.definition: Strange or mysterious, especially in an unsettling way.
meanings.sent1: The old house had an uncanny feeling, making me shiver.
meanings.sent2: The uncanny noise in the dark forest sent chills down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The uncanny shadow on the wall turned out to be just a trick of the light.
meanings.sent4: Her uncanny ability to predict the future amazed everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The uncanny resemblance between the twins was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: Beyond what is normal or expected; suggesting supernatural or inexplicable powers.
meanings.sent1: The magician's uncanny tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The uncanny strength of the superhero saved the city from disaster.
meanings.sent3: The uncanny speed at which the cake disappeared puzzled the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Her uncanny intuition seemed almost magical in its accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The uncanny glow of the mysterious object captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Eerily familiar or reminiscent of something else.
meanings.sent1: The uncanny smell of the bakery reminded me of my childhood home.
meanings.sent2: The uncanny melody of the song brought back memories of happier times.
meanings.sent3: The uncanny coincidence of meeting my old friend in a foreign country made us both laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her uncanny ability to mimic voices made her a hit at the talent show.
meanings.sent5: The uncanny deja vu feeling made me question reality for a moment.
